title: @Riot: Any chance we can tune Leona outside of support?
body: I love Leona; she's one of my favorite champions in the game and I even enjoy her enough to play her support even though it's a role I don't normally play. However, I also like to play her top and occasionally jungle, and frankly, she's not very good at either. She's certainly playable at either position but she's basically a cheese pick that can't compete with meta champs from a raw stats perspective. However, she's actually not far off from being viable in those roles. And honestly, I see no reason why she can't be seriously viable in those roles without making her broken as a support. All she would really need is slightly better base AS, slightly more AD growth per level, slightly increased attack range, and some extra waveclear/jungle clear power, perhaps with Eclipse dealing bonus damage to minions and monsters. And honestly, you could probably make all of these changes without buffing support Leona much at all, although you could probably justify a very minor nerf to Sunlight should these buffs go through. Lulu, Zilean, Tahm, Nautilus, Morgana, Karma, Zyra, and Alistar are all supports and also viable solo laners, so why not Leona? Hell, she was even played as a solo laner for part of her champion spotlight back in the day, so solo lane Leona was clearly an intended thing in the beginning. So why not now?

Or the shield could be only for when she is without a nearby allied champion

And she's honestly not that bad of a duelist already; she already outduels a fair number of meta top laners as it is. Frankly, there's nothing about her kit that "disallows" her from playing either role, only that the numbers are slightly too weak to support her in those roles compared to meta champs. Tune those numbers and Leona could easily play either role no problem. Compare that to Soraka or Sona who could never jungle without extremely drastic changes.

As for making her OP by making her viable damage wise, that certainly didn't stop them on Nautilus who has basically the same skillset as Leona while also having high enough damage to be a viable LCS top laner. If Nautilus gets to top lane, then Leona should honestly be able to top lane too.

Viktor does not have base AP or AP per level. He does however have an item unique to himself that gives these stats. That item, however, takes up an item slot and is upgraded by spending gold as you would purchase other items. A very unique item, but nonetheless he still doesn't have base AP or AP per level.

Galio would be a much better argument... as he does have base MR and MR per level and a passive that converts MR to AP. However that still isn't really the same thing. That AP is not "base AP", it's bonus AP that he gains through base stats.

Why do Naut and Tahm get to be a support, jungler **and** top laner and Leona only a support? Give me a **real** answer.

First off, Naut is in a bad spot anyways, and has a higher win rate as support than top or jungle. Second, while Naut does have a lot of CC, Leona has a good 150 range on him (Naut's Q+R= 1955 and Leona's R+E= 2075) Making her ganks scarier. On top of that, Leona's ult has a much lower CD than Naut's, making her ganks even more scarier. As far as your "real" answer, Tahm was broken as fuck and just did what he wanted, he was also designed around his whole "eat people" theme and Riot didn't really have a role assigned to him. And Naut was primary made to be a jungler, but it just so happens that a ton of CC is good for bot lane too.

The only other role I can see Leona feasibly existing in, without having to change her too much, is top. But even that would require a few changes and it would likely wipe support Leona from existence.
